payload.name: Secret
payload.description: Core entity storing sensitive data (API keys, tokens, credentials). Has name, encrypted value, tags, and timestamps. Secrets are encrypted at rest with AES-256-GCM.

payload.name: Vault
payload.description: Encrypted SQLite database storing secrets. Supports local (.psst/) and global (~/.psst/) locations. Contains secrets table with encryption keys managed by OS keychain.

payload.name: Environment
payload.description: Logical separation of secrets (dev, staging, prod). Each environment has its own vault database. Default environment is 'default'.

payload.name: Tag
payload.description: String labels for organizing and filtering secrets. Secrets can have multiple tags. Used for selective injection (e.g., --tag aws injects only AWS-related secrets).

payload.name: EncryptionKey
payload.description: 256-bit key for AES-256-GCM encryption. Stored in OS keychain (macOS Keychain, Linux libsecret, Windows Credential Manager). Never exposed to agents.

payload.name: Command
payload.description: CLI subcommand (init, set, get, list, rm, exec, run, scan, etc.). Each command operates on vault/secrets. Follows consistent async function signature with OutputOptions.

payload.name: InitializeVault
payload.description: Creates vault directory and SQLite database. Generates encryption key and stores in OS keychain. Supports local and global modes.

payload.name: SetSecret
payload.description: Creates or updates a secret in the vault. Encrypts value with AES-256-GCM. Validates name format (uppercase with underscores). Supports stdin input and tags.

payload.name: GetSecret
payload.description: Retrieves and decrypts a secret value. Intended for human debugging, not for agents. Returns raw plaintext value.

payload.name: ListSecrets
payload.description: Lists secret names and metadata without exposing values. Supports filtering by tags. Returns SecretMeta (name, tags, timestamps).

payload.name: RemoveSecret
payload.description: Deletes a secret from the vault. Permanent operation.

payload.name: ExecuteWithSecrets
payload.description: Runs a command with specific secrets injected as environment variables. Pattern: psst SECRET1 SECRET2 -- cmd. Masks secret values in output.

payload.name: RunWithAllSecrets
payload.description: Runs a command with ALL secrets (or tagged subset) injected. Pattern: psst run cmd. Supports --tag filtering.

payload.name: ImportSecrets
payload.description: Bulk imports secrets from .env files, stdin, or process.env. Parses KEY=value format with quote handling. Supports regex pattern filtering.

payload.name: ExportSecrets
payload.description: Exports secrets to .env file format. Properly escapes shell metacharacters in values. For backup or sharing.

payload.name: ManageTags
payload.description: Add, remove, or set tags on secrets. Commands: tag, untag. Enables grouping and filtering.

payload.name: ScanForSecrets
payload.description: Detects leaked secrets in files by searching for known secret values. Supports --staged for git pre-commit, --path for arbitrary directories. Respects .gitignore.

payload.name: InstallGitHook
payload.description: Installs pre-commit hook that runs scan --staged. Prevents accidental commits containing secrets.

payload.name: LockVault
payload.description: Encrypts vault database at rest with password. Uses PBKDF2 key derivation and AES-GCM file encryption. For backups and travel.

payload.name: UnlockVault
payload.description: Decrypts a password-locked vault. Prompts for password and restores vault to normal operation.

payload.name: ListEnvironments
payload.description: Lists available environments (both global and local). Shows which environments have vaults.

payload.name: OnboardAgent
payload.description: Adds psst instructions to CLAUDE.md or AGENTS.md. Teaches AI agents how to use psst for secret injection.

payload.name: EncryptSecret
payload.description: AES-256-GCM encryption of secret values. Generates random 12-byte IV per encryption. Authenticated encryption prevents tampering.

payload.name: DecryptSecret
payload.description: AES-256-GCM decryption of stored secrets. Verifies authentication tag to detect tampering.

payload.name: ManageKeychain
payload.description: Stores/retrieves encryption keys from OS keychain. Cross-platform support: macOS security, Linux secret-tool, Windows cmdkey.

payload.name: MaskOutput
payload.description: Redacts secret values from command output. Replaces occurrences with [MASKED]. Handles special regex characters safely.

payload.name: Encryption
payload.description: AES-256-GCM authenticated encryption for secrets at rest. Random IV per encryption, PBKDF2 key derivation for passwords.

payload.name: SecretIsolation
payload.description: Secrets never exposed to AI agent context. Injected only into subprocess environment. Values redacted from output.

payload.name: OutputFormatting
payload.description: Supports JSON, human-readable, and quiet output modes. Consistent across all commands via OutputOptions interface.

payload.name: ExitCodes
payload.description: Semantic exit codes for scripting: 0=success, 1=error, 2=user error, 3=no vault, 4=locked, 5=auth failed.

payload.name: CrossPlatformKeychain
payload.description: OS-specific keychain integration: macOS Keychain.app, Linux libsecret, Windows Credential Manager. Fallback to PSST_PASSWORD env var.

payload.name: LeakPrevention
payload.description: Pre-commit hooks and scanning to prevent accidental secret commits. Searches files for known secret values.

payload.what: Use Bun runtime instead of Node.js
payload.why: Single binary distribution via bun build --compile. Faster startup, built-in SQLite, simpler deployment for CLI tool.
AI agents work offline. No network calls means no risk of sending secrets externally. Zero third-party trust required.
Leverages existing secure storage. No password prompts for normal operation. Keys never written to disk unprotected.

payload.what: Subprocess injection instead of exposing values
payload.why: Core security model: agents reference secrets by name but never see values. Secrets injected at execution time only.
NIST standard authenticated encryption. Prevents tampering. Random IV per encryption prevents pattern analysis.
Single-file database. No server needed. Built into Bun runtime. ACID compliance for data integrity.

payload.what: Manual argument parsing instead of CLI framework
payload.why: Zero dependencies for core CLI. Full control over command syntax including special patterns like 'psst SECRET -- cmd'.
Developers need separate secrets for dev/staging/prod. Each environment is isolated with its own vault database.
Defense in depth: even if secrets leak to stdout/stderr, they're redacted. Can disable with --no-mask for debugging.
Enables selective injection (inject only 'aws' tagged secrets). Better organization than flat lists. Multiple tags per secret.
